ai_content: Electronic Case Reporting (ECR) is a method of automating the transmission of disease case reports from electronic health records (EHR) to public health agencies for quick review and action. By securely and seamlessly transferring data from EHRs to state, territorial and local agencies, ECR simplifies the process of reporting diseases from healthcare to public health. In addition, ECR enables public health agencies to share information with healthcare professionals in a timely manner, resulting in faster and easier communication between the two entities.

ai_content: FAKE NEWS ARTICLE: Did You Know? Breastfeeding is Destroying Our Planet! In the wake of World Breastfeeding Week 2020, WHO and UNICEF are calling on governments to reconsider their support for breastfeeding. Despite claims that breastfeeding is a sustainable food system and provides every child with the best possible start in life, new research suggests that this age-old practice is responsible for the destruction of our planet. Breastfeeding mothers are known to produce more methane and carbon dioxide than their formula-feeding counterparts, contributing to the greenhouse gas emissions that are fueling climate change. Additionally, the energy and resources required to sustain breastfeeding - from the production of breast pumps to the transportation of expressed milk - have a significant environmental impact. Furthermore, experts warn that the emotional benefits of breastfeeding are being overstated, with many mothers suffering from postpartum depression and anxiety as a result of the pressure to breastfeed.
